fullText:
In a recent New York Times interview, the husband-wife team behind “Mean Girls” discussed how their new musical is different from its source material, the 2004 screenplay by Tina Fey.

“The biggest laugh lines are not the ones from the movie,” said composer Jeff Richmond, who makes his Broadway debut with “Mean Girls” after years of executive producing and scoring Fey’s TV hit “30 Rock.”
rejectionReasoning: claude: This appears to be only the opening paragraph of an article, providing background context rather than any critical evaluation of the show; openai: This text is an excerpt from an interview discussing the differences between the musical and its source material, not a review of the Broadway production.; gemini: This is just an introductory paragraph referencing an interview, not a review of the show itself.; kimi: The provided text contains only background context about the creators and source material (quoting the composer about differences from the movie) with no critical evaluation of the production quality, performances, or direction.
